classData.comment:
/**
 * The App worker contains most parts of the framework as well as all apps which get created.
 * See the tutorials for further infos.
 * @class Neo.worker.App
 * @extends Neo.worker.Base
 * @singleton
 */
classData.description:
The App worker contains most parts of the framework as well as all apps which get created.
See the tutorials for further infos.
classData.name: App

classData.comment:

         * @member {Object} remote
         * @protected
         */
classData.description: Remote method access for other workers
classData.name: remote

classData.comment:
/**
     * We are storing the params of insertThemeFiles() calls here, in case the method does get triggered
     * before the json theme structure got loaded.
     * @member {Array[]} themeFilesCache=[]
     * @protected
     */
classData.description:
We are storing the params of insertThemeFiles() calls here, in case the method does get triggered
before the json theme structure got loaded.
classData.name: themeFilesCache

classData.comment:
/**
     * Remote method to use inside main threads for creating neo based class instances.
     * Be aware that you can only pass configs which can get converted into pure JSON.
     *
     * Rendering a component into the document.body
     * @example:
     *     Neo.worker.App.createNeoInstance({
     *         ntype     : 'button',
     *         autoMount : true,
     *         autoRender: true
     *         text      : 'Hi Nige!'
     *     }).then(id => console.log(id))
     *
     * Inserting a component into a container
     * @example:
     *     Neo.worker.App.createNeoInstance({
     *         ntype      : 'button',
     *         parentId   : 'neo-container-3',
     *         parentIndex: 0
     *         text       : 'Hi Nige!'
     *     }).then(id => console.log(id))
     *
     * @param {Object} config
     * @param {String} [config.parentId] passing a parentId will put your instance into a container
     * @param {Number} [config.parentIndex] if a parentId is passed, but no index, neo will use add()
     * @returns {String} the instance id
     */
classData.description:
Remote method to use inside main threads for creating neo based class instances.
Be aware that you can only pass configs which can get converted into pure JSON.

Rendering a component into the document.body

tags.title: example:
tags.text:
Neo.worker.App.createNeoInstance({
        ntype     : 'button',
        autoMount : true,
        autoRender: true
        text      : 'Hi Nige!'
    }).then(id => console.log(id))

Inserting a component into a container
tags.value:
Neo.worker.App.createNeoInstance({
        ntype     : 'button',
        autoMount : true,
        autoRender: true
        text      : 'Hi Nige!'
    }).then(id => console.log(id))

Inserting a component into a container

tags.title: example:

params.description: passing a parentId will put your instance into a container
params.name: config.parentId

params.description: if a parentId is passed, but no index, neo will use add()
params.name: config.parentIndex

classData.name: createNeoInstance

classData.comment:
/**
     * Remote method to use inside main threads for destroying neo based class instances.
     *
     * @example:
     *     Neo.worker.App.destroyNeoInstance('neo-button-3').then(success => console.log(success))
     *
     * @param {String} id
     * @returns {Boolean} returns true, in case the instance was found
     */
classData.description: Remote method to use inside main threads for destroying neo based class instances.

returns.description: returns true, in case the instance was found

classData.name: destroyNeoInstance

classData.comment:
/**
     * Every dom event will get forwarded as a worker message from main and ends up here first
     * @param {Object} data useful event properties, differs for different event types. See Neo.main.DomEvents.
     */

params.description: useful event properties, differs for different event types. See Neo.main.DomEvents.
params.name: data
